data.name: 164.312(a)(1) Access Controls
data.description: Implement technical policies and procedures for electronic information systems that maintain electronic protected health information to allow access only to those persons or software programs that have been granted access rights as specified in § 164.308(a)(4).

tests.title: CloudTrail Bucket Delete Policy
tests.description: Ensures CloudTrail logging bucket has a policy to prevent deletion of logs without an MFA token
tests.more_info: To provide additional security, CloudTrail logging buckets should require an MFA token to delete objects
tests.recommended_action: Enable MFA delete on the CloudTrail bucket

tests.title: Detect EC2 Classic Instances
tests.description: Ensures AWS VPC is being used for instances instead of EC2 Classic
tests.more_info: VPCs are the latest and more secure method of launching AWS resources. EC2 Classic should not be used.
tests.recommended_action: Migrate instances from EC2 Classic to VPC

tests.title: RDS Publicly Accessible
tests.description: Ensures RDS instances are not launched into the public cloud
tests.more_info: Unless there is a specific business requirement, RDS instances should not have a public endpoint and should be accessed from within a VPC only.
tests.recommended_action: Remove the public endpoint from the RDS instance

tests.title: Redshift Publicly Accessible
tests.description: Ensures Redshift clusters are not launched into the public cloud
tests.more_info: Unless there is a specific business requirement, Redshift clusters should not have a public endpoint and should be accessed from within a VPC only.
tests.recommended_action: Remove the public endpoint from the Redshift cluster

tests.title: Open All Ports Protocols
tests.description: Determine if security group has all ports or protocols open to the public
tests.more_info: Security groups should be created on a per-service basis and avoid allowing all ports or protocols.
tests.recommended_action: Modify the security group to specify a specific port and protocol to allow.

data.name: 164.312(a)(2)(iv) Encryption and Decryption (Addressable)
data.description: Implement a mechanism to encrypt and decrypt electronic protected health information.

tests.title: RDS Encryption Enabled
tests.description: Ensures at-rest encryption is setup for RDS instances
tests.more_info: AWS provides at-read encryption for RDS instances which should be enabled to ensure the integrity of data stored within the databases.
tests.recommended_action: RDS does not currently allow modifications to encryption after the instance has been launched, so a new instance will need to be created with encryption enabled.

tests.title: Redshift Encryption Enabled
tests.description: Ensures at-rest encryption is setup for Redshift clusters
tests.more_info: AWS provides at-read encryption for Redshift clusters which should be enabled to ensure the integrity of data stored within the cluster.
tests.recommended_action: Redshift does not currently allow modifications to encryption after the cluster has been launched, so a new cluster will need to be created with encryption enabled.

tests.title: Encrypted AMI
tests.description: Ensures EBS-backed AMIs are configured to use encryption
tests.more_info: AMIs with unencrypted data volumes can be used to launch unencrypted instances that place data at risk.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure all AMIs have encrypted EBS volumes.

tests.title: EBS Encryption Enabled
tests.description: Ensures EBS volumes are encrypted at rest
tests.more_info: EBS volumes should have at-rest encryption enabled through AWS using KMS. If the volume is used for a root volume, the instance must be launched from an AMI that has been encrypted as well.
tests.recommended_action: Enable encryption for EBS volumes.

tests.title: SQS Encrypted
tests.description: Ensures SQS encryption is enabled
tests.more_info: Messages sent to SQS queues can be encrypted using KMS server-side encryption. Existing queues can be modified to add encryption with minimal overhead.
tests.recommended_action: Enable encryption using KMS for all SQS queues.
tests.remediation_description: Encryption for the affected SQS queues will be enabled.

data.name: 164.312(b) Audit Controls
data.description: Implement hardware, software, and/or procedural mechanisms that record and examine activity in information systems that contain or use electronic protected health information.

tests.title: CloudTrail Enabled
tests.description: Ensures CloudTrail is enabled for all regions within an account
tests.more_info: CloudTrail should be enabled for all regions in order to detect suspicious activity in regions that are not typically used.
tests.recommended_action: Enable CloudTrail for all regions and ensure that at least one region monitors global service events

results.message: CloudTrail is not configured to monitor global services

tests.title: CloudTrail File Validation
tests.description: Ensures CloudTrail file validation is enabled for all regions within an account
tests.more_info: CloudTrail file validation is essentially a hash of the file which can be used to ensure its integrity in the case of an account compromise.
tests.recommended_action: Enable CloudTrail file validation for all regions
tests.remediation_description: File validation will be enabled for the trail

tests.title: CloudTrail Bucket Access Logging
tests.description: Ensures CloudTrail logging bucket has access logging enabled to detect tampering of log files
tests.more_info: CloudTrail buckets should utilize access logging for an additional layer of auditing. If the log files are deleted or modified in any way, the additional access logs can help determine who made the changes.
tests.recommended_action: Enable access logging on the CloudTrail bucket from the S3 console

tests.title: VPC Flow Logs Enabled
tests.description: Ensures VPC flow logs are enabled for traffic logging
tests.more_info: VPC flow logs record all traffic flowing in to and out of a VPC. These logs are critical for auditing and review after security incidents.
tests.recommended_action: Enable VPC flow logs for each VPC

results.message: VPC flow logs are not enabled
VPC flow logs are not enabled
VPC flow logs are not enabled
VPC flow logs are not enabled
VPC flow logs are not enabled

VPC flow logs are not enabled

tests.title: ELB Logging Enabled
tests.description: Ensures load balancers have request logging enabled.
tests.more_info: Logging requests to ELB endpoints is a helpful way of detecting and investigating potential attacks, malicious activity, or misuse of backend resources.Logs can be sent to S3 and processed for further analysis.
tests.recommended_action: Enable ELB request logging

tests.title: CloudFront Logging Enabled
tests.description: Ensures CloudFront distributions have request logging enabled.
tests.more_info: Logging requests to CloudFront distributions is a helpful way of detecting and investigating potential attacks, malicious activity, or misuse of backend resources. Logs can be sent to S3 and processed for further analysis.
tests.recommended_action: Enable CloudFront request logging.

tests.title: S3 Bucket Logging
tests.description: Ensures S3 bucket logging is enabled for S3 buckets
tests.more_info: S3 bucket logging helps maintain an audit trail of                 access that can be used in the event of a security                 incident.
tests.recommended_action: Enable bucket logging for each S3 bucket.

tests.title: Transfer Logging Enabled
tests.description: Ensures AWS Transfer servers have CloudWatch logging enabled.
tests.more_info: AWS Transfer servers can log activity to CloudWatch if a proper IAM service role is provided. This role should be configured for all servers to ensure proper access logging.
tests.recommended_action: Provide a valid IAM service role for AWS Transfer servers.

data.name: 164.312(c) Integrity
data.description: Implement policies and procedures to protect electronic protected health information from improper alteration or destruction.

tests.title: RDS Publicly Accessible
tests.description: Ensures RDS instances are not launched into the public cloud
tests.more_info: Unless there is a specific business requirement, RDS instances should not have a public endpoint and should be accessed from within a VPC only.
tests.recommended_action: Remove the public endpoint from the RDS instance

tests.title: CloudTrail File Validation
tests.description: Ensures CloudTrail file validation is enabled for all regions within an account
tests.more_info: CloudTrail file validation is essentially a hash of the file which can be used to ensure its integrity in the case of an account compromise.
tests.recommended_action: Enable CloudTrail file validation for all regions
tests.remediation_description: File validation will be enabled for the trail

tests.title: CloudTrail Bucket Access Logging
tests.description: Ensures CloudTrail logging bucket has access logging enabled to detect tampering of log files
tests.more_info: CloudTrail buckets should utilize access logging for an additional layer of auditing. If the log files are deleted or modified in any way, the additional access logs can help determine who made the changes.
tests.recommended_action: Enable access logging on the CloudTrail bucket from the S3 console

tests.title: Redshift Publicly Accessible
tests.description: Ensures Redshift clusters are not launched into the public cloud
tests.more_info: Unless there is a specific business requirement, Redshift clusters should not have a public endpoint and should be accessed from within a VPC only.
tests.recommended_action: Remove the public endpoint from the Redshift cluster

data.name: 164.312(d) Person or Entity Authentication
data.description: Implement procedures to verify that a person or entity seeking access to electronic protected health information is the one claimed.

tests.title: CloudTrail Bucket Delete Policy
tests.description: Ensures CloudTrail logging bucket has a policy to prevent deletion of logs without an MFA token
tests.more_info: To provide additional security, CloudTrail logging buckets should require an MFA token to delete objects
tests.recommended_action: Enable MFA delete on the CloudTrail bucket

tests.title: Root Access Keys
tests.description: Ensures the root account is not using access keys
tests.more_info: The root account should avoid using access keys. Since the root account has full permissions across the entire account, creating access keys for it only increases the chance that they are compromised. Instead, create IAM users with predefined roles.
tests.recommended_action: Remove access keys for the root account and setup IAM users with limited permissions instead

results.message: Access keys were not found for the root account

tests.title: Users MFA Enabled
tests.description: Ensures a multi-factor authentication device is enabled for all users within the account
tests.more_info: User accounts should have an MFA device setup to enable two-factor authentication
tests.recommended_action: Enable an MFA device for the user account

tests.title: Access Keys Rotated
tests.description: Ensures access keys are not older than 180 days in order to reduce accidental exposures
tests.more_info: Access keys should be rotated frequently to avoid having them accidentally exposed.
tests.recommended_action: To rotate an access key, first create a new key, replace the key and secret throughout your app or scripts, then set the previous key to disabled. Once you ensure that no services are broken, then fully delete the old key.

tests.title: Root Account In Use
tests.description: Ensures the root account is not being actively used
tests.more_info: The root account should not be used for day-to-day account management. IAM users, roles, and groups should be used instead.
tests.recommended_action: Create IAM users with appropriate group-level permissions for account access. Create an MFA token for the root account, and store its password and token generation QR codes in a secure place.

results.message: Root account was last used 0 days ago

data.name: 164.312(e)(1) Transmission Security
data.description: Implement technical security measures to guard against unauthorized access to electronic protected health information that is being transmitted over an electronic communications network.

tests.title: Insecure Ciphers
tests.description: Detect use of insecure ciphers on ELBs
tests.more_info: Various security vulnerabilities have rendered several ciphers insecure. Only the recommended ciphers should be used.
tests.recommended_action: Update your ELBs to use the recommended cipher suites

tests.title: Secure CloudFront Origin
tests.description: Detects the use of secure web origins with secure protocols for CloudFront.
tests.more_info: Traffic passed between the CloudFront edge nodes and the backend resource should be sent over HTTPS with modern protocols for all web-based origins.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that traffic sent between CloudFront and its origin is passed over HTTPS and uses TLSv1.1 or higher. Do not use the match-viewer option.

results.message: No CloudFront origins without HTTPS or with insecure protocols found

tests.title: Insecure CloudFront Protocols
tests.description: Detects the use of insecure HTTPS SSL/TLS protocols for use with HTTPS traffic between viewers and CloudFront
tests.more_info: CloudFront supports SSLv3 and TLSv1 protocols for use with HTTPS traffic, but only TLSv1.1 or higher should be used unless there is a valid business justification to support the older, insecure SSLv3.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that traffic sent between viewers and CloudFront is passed over HTTPS and uses TLSv1.1 or higher.

tests.title: CloudFront HTTPS Only
tests.description: Ensures CloudFront distributions are configured to redirect non-HTTPS traffic to HTTPS.
tests.more_info: For maximum security, CloudFront distributions can be configured to only accept HTTPS connections or to redirect HTTP connections to HTTPS.
tests.recommended_action: Remove HTTP-only listeners from distributions.
tests.remediation_description: CloudFront distribution will be configured to only accept HTTPS connections or to redirect HTTP connections to HTTPS.

data.name: 164.312(e)(2)(i) Integrity Controls
data.description: Implement security measures to ensure that electronically transmitted electronic protected health information is not improperly modified without detection until disposed of.

tests.title: Insecure Ciphers
tests.description: Detect use of insecure ciphers on ELBs
tests.more_info: Various security vulnerabilities have rendered several ciphers insecure. Only the recommended ciphers should be used.
tests.recommended_action: Update your ELBs to use the recommended cipher suites

data.name: 164.312(e)(2)(ii) Encryption
data.description: Implement a mechanism to encrypt electronic protected health information whenever deemed appropriate.

tests.title: RDS Encryption Enabled
tests.description: Ensures at-rest encryption is setup for RDS instances
tests.more_info: AWS provides at-read encryption for RDS instances which should be enabled to ensure the integrity of data stored within the databases.
tests.recommended_action: RDS does not currently allow modifications to encryption after the instance has been launched, so a new instance will need to be created with encryption enabled.

tests.title: Redshift Encryption Enabled
tests.description: Ensures at-rest encryption is setup for Redshift clusters
tests.more_info: AWS provides at-read encryption for Redshift clusters which should be enabled to ensure the integrity of data stored within the cluster.
tests.recommended_action: Redshift does not currently allow modifications to encryption after the cluster has been launched, so a new cluster will need to be created with encryption enabled.

tests.title: Encrypted AMI
tests.description: Ensures EBS-backed AMIs are configured to use encryption
tests.more_info: AMIs with unencrypted data volumes can be used to launch unencrypted instances that place data at risk.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure all AMIs have encrypted EBS volumes.

tests.title: EBS Encryption Enabled
tests.description: Ensures EBS volumes are encrypted at rest
tests.more_info: EBS volumes should have at-rest encryption enabled through AWS using KMS. If the volume is used for a root volume, the instance must be launched from an AMI that has been encrypted as well.
tests.recommended_action: Enable encryption for EBS volumes.

tests.title: SQS Encrypted
tests.description: Ensures SQS encryption is enabled
tests.more_info: Messages sent to SQS queues can be encrypted using KMS server-side encryption. Existing queues can be modified to add encryption with minimal overhead.
tests.recommended_action: Enable encryption using KMS for all SQS queues.
tests.remediation_description: Encryption for the affected SQS queues will be enabled.

tests.title: EBS Encrypted Snapshots
tests.description: Ensures EBS snapshots are encrypted at rest
tests.more_info: EBS snapshots should have at-rest encryption enabled through AWS using KMS. If the volume was not encrypted and a snapshot was taken the snapshot will be unencrypted.
tests.recommended_action: Configure volume encryption and delete unencrypted EBS snapshots.

tests.title: Kinesis Streams Encrypted
tests.description: Ensures Kinesis Streams encryption is enabled
tests.more_info: Data sent to Kinesis Streams can be encrypted using KMS server-side encryption. Existing streams can be modified to add encryption with minimal overhead.
tests.recommended_action: Enable encryption using KMS for all Kinesis Streams.
tests.remediation_description: Encryption for the affected Kinesis streams will be enabled.

tests.title: Firehose Delivery Streams Encrypted
tests.description: Ensures Firehose Delivery Stream encryption is enabled
tests.more_info: Data sent through Firehose Delivery Streams can be encrypted using KMS server-side encryption. Existing delivery streams can be modified to add encryption with minimal overhead.
tests.recommended_action: Enable encryption using KMS for all Firehose Delivery Streams.

tests.title: SSM Encrypted Parameters
tests.description: Ensures SSM Parameters are encrypted
tests.more_info: SSM Parameters should be encrypted. This allows their values to be used by approved systems, while restricting access to other users of the account.
tests.recommended_action: Recreate unencrypted SSM Parameters with Type set to SecureString.

tests.title: Notebook Data Encrypted
tests.description: Ensure Notebook data is encrypted
tests.more_info: An optional encryption key can be supplied during Notebook Instance creation.
tests.recommended_action: An existing KMS key should be supplied during Notebook Instance creation.
